Package com.intel.fightclub.dialog.queries

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BargeInOccurred
    KM Query indicating if barge in occurred during the last utterance being spoken to the user.
    CanCancelWorkout
    Determines whether a workout can be cancelled or the user has made enough progress in the workout that cancellation is no longer possible.
    CanUserDoPlannedWorkout
    Determines whether a user can do a planned workout.
    DoesTrainingTypeRequirePowerMeter  
    ExpectedRangeQuery
    Additional layer of abstraction for a query that deals with expected ranges for a variety of metrics.
    FitnessFilterQuery
    This class groups all queries asking for a metric value or property.
    GenerateUtterance  
    GetAverageMetrics
    This query is used to get the average values of different metrics, such as Speed, Power, etc.
    GetConnectedDataStreams
    This query returns all sensors that are currently connected.
    GetCurrentEffortZone
    Retrieves the effort zone classified in the current phase of the Workout.
    GetCurrentMetrics
    This query is used to get the current values of several supported metrics, like speed, pace, heart rate, stride length, stride rate, etc.
    GetCurrentTrainingType
    Retrieves the training type classified in the current phase of the Workout.
    GetCurrentWorkout
    This query is used to get the current cumulative values of the given workout, such as current duration, distance Calories burnt, etc.
    GetCurrentWorkoutActivity
    Gets the activity for the current workout.
    GetDataStreamsQuery
    Common abstraction for GetRecommendedDataStreams and GetRequiredDataStreams.
    GetDeviceBatteryLevel
    Query which can return the battery level of the wearable and/or phone.
    GetElapsedTime
    Retrieves the time in seconds (including pauses) that has passed since the workout was started.
    GetGlassesState
    This query is used to retrieving the current state of the wearables.
    GetMetricCompliance
    CUI query to ask about planned, completed or remaining values for distance, duration and vertical climb.
    GetMetricExpectedRange  
    GetMetricExpectedRangeForEffortZone  
    GetMetricExpectedRangeForTrainingType  
    GetMetricQuality
    Implementation of GetMetricQuality query.
    GetNextWorkoutPlan
    Allow the user to query about the next upcoming plan, from tomorrow onwards.
    GetPerformanceTrend
    Query to get performance trends.
    GetPhoneTime
    Gets the phone time, already formatted to the 12 or 24 hour format.
    GetPlannedWorkoutType
    Query to get planned workout type.
    GetPreferredDataStreams
    Returns a user's preferred data streams.
    GetPreferredWorkoutMeasure
    Query for retrieving the measure (e.g.
    GetProgramActivities
    Gets the list of activities associated to the current program (independently of the program status).
    GetRecommendedDataStreams
    Retrieves a list of sensor data streams recommended for a given activity.
    GetRepDurationRequirementForTrainingType
    This query returns the duration range in seconds required to qualify for a given training type while meeting the classification requirements.
    GetRequiredDataStreams
    This query returns all sensors that are required for a given activity.
    GetSensorState
    This query is used to retrieving the current state of one or more data streams, as described in DialogSensor
    GetTotalDistance
    Returns total distance in the workout (including pause or distance walked before the WO started).
    GetTotalVerticalDistance
    Returns total vertical distance in the workout (including pause or distance walked before the WO started)
    GetTrainingTypeCompliance
    CUI queries to enable training types compliance with respect to the current plan.
    GetTrainingTypeComplianceTest
    Tests GetTrainingTypeCompliance.
    GetVerbosityLevel
    Query for getting current verbosity level.
    GetWarmupComplianceDuration
    Query for retrieving planned, completed, and remaining duration information for planned warmups.
    GetWorkoutType
    This query is used to get the workout type selected by the user.
    GetWorkoutUserState
    This query checks the state of the current workout, in order to proceed with certain queries that can be issued only when the workout is in a given state (e.g.
    IsActivitySupported
    Enables the CUI to verify whether an activity is currently supported or not.
    IsSensorPaired
    Returns true if a given sensor type is paired to the device.
    IsUserCalibratedForActivity
    Indicates if a user is calibrated for a given activity.
    SensorQuery
    Implements common methods for all sensor queries
    WillStopCancelWorkout
    Returns true if calling UpdateWorkoutState(Stop) will actually cancel the workout.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    SensorQuery.SensorRequirement
    Whether sensor is required.
